TopicTitle: This is why KSP is awesome!

Articles.Content:
When I saw the lastest mun rover included in 'Cart' plugin(which is awesome), I immidiately thought about a thing that I\'m going to show to you in just a minute. In theory it might be possible now, someone would just have to develop a plugin which adds functions described below.

**Let\'s say a plane** carrying important cargo(Jeb\'s cat it might be) crashed in a terrain that\'s difficult to reach by land rovers OR crashing a rocket into an area next to our plane is not an option. This is when these little friends called unmanned vehicles(or drones) come into action.

A plane is launched from KSP, carrying two of these. Rescue mission is about to begin.

> ![tripa.png](http://img822.imageshack.us/img822/6730/tripa.png)

When the time comes, our robots are deployed into action.

> ![screenshot11ro.png](http://img232.imageshack.us/img232/8183/screenshot11ro.png)

Next step is fairly simple. After touchdown, onboard computers start and drones collect our target of great importance and then head to extraction area, where a transporter is waiting.

> ![deployed.png](http://img14.imageshack.us/img14/1829/deployed.png)

KSP is really going to be an outstanding game, I\'m sure of that! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I was thinking about making something like a C-130 that drops stuff out the back of a cargo hold made from the rectangular wing sections.

I desperately hope that programmable autonomous vehicles are added in the future. As a robotics student it would be amazing to build a probe or drone and then program its behavior and just send it off and watch it go.

> 
> I desperately hope that programmable autonomous vehicles are added in the future. As a robotics student it would be amazing to build a probe or drone and then program its behavior and just send it off and watch it go.

Yeah, I\'d really like to see it. It would add so many possibilities to the game.
I would love to construct, program, then send a rover to the mun/minmus/whateverelsethereistocome.. That would be so amazing.
The next MechJeb will have a console window you can use for giving orders to it. So maybe we\'ll also get MechJeb scripting...
It might be a little more difficult than programming a BigTrak though.
You can already control those rovers by sticking a mechjeb on each one of them.

> 
> You can already control those rovers by sticking a mechjeb on each one of them.

But that\'s not the point, he wants to program them and watch them run, not control them.

> 
> It might be a little more difficult than programming a BigTrak though.

It may not be too bad though, a huge ammount of the difficulty in programming a robot comes from lower level stuff like reading sensors and controlling actuators. Not to mention accounting for unreliability and inaccuracy.

You could do some pretty powerful things with very basic instructions when you can guarantee reliability and consistency.

Ultimately, your idea could enable us to do something like the White Knight / Spaceship One combination. After separation, both craft need to be piloted simultaneously. But if the carrier could glide down on autopilot, the investors would be much happier. Something tells me this scenario asks a lot.
